Header: Osaka ends Andreescu’s 17-match winning run in three-set thriller
Content: In a battle of Grand Slam champions, Japan’s Naomi Osaka beat U.S. Open holder Bianca Andreescu 5-7 6-3 6-4 in a thrilling quarter-final at the China Open in Beijing. Osaka’s victory ended her Canadian opponents 17-match winning streak, stretching as far back as the Miami Open in March.Osaka fired 10 aces, 31 winners and won 78% of her first service points in a see-saw encounter that had a total of 11 breaks of serve. She will play defending champion Caroline Wozniacki, who beat Russia’s Daria Kasatkina 6-3 7-6(5), in the semi-finals.Osaka became the fifth player to qualify for the season-ending WTA Finals in Shenzhen after Ash Barty, Karolina Pliskova, Wimbledon champion Simona Halep and Andreescu.
